info.title: Microfox X SDK API
info.description: Single entry-point API for all Microfox X SDK functions via a wrapper Lambda

post.summary: Creates a new tweet on X with specified content and options.
post.description: This function posts a new tweet to X (formerly Twitter) with the given content and various optional parameters. It allows for customization of the tweet, including attaching media, creating polls, setting reply preferences, and more. The function returns a promise that resolves to the created tweet data.

body.description: Body of the create sls call

items.description: TweetCreate object containing the tweet content and options

text.description: The text content of the tweet

card_uri.description: The URI of a card to attach to the tweet

community_id.description: The ID of the community to post the tweet to

direct_message_deep_link.description: A deep link to a direct message

for_super_followers_only.description: Whether the tweet is for super followers only

place_id.description: The ID of the place to attach to the tweet

media.description: Media information to attach to the tweet

media_ids.description: An array of media IDs to attach to the tweet

tagged_user_ids.description: An array of user IDs to tag in the media

nullcast.description: Whether the tweet is a nullcast

duration_minutes.description: The duration of the poll in minutes (min: 5, max: 10080)

reply_settings.description: The reply settings for the poll

quote_tweet_id.description: The ID of the tweet to quote

in_reply_to_tweet_id.description: The ID of the tweet being replied to

exclude_reply_user_ids.description: An array of user IDs to exclude from the reply

reply_settings.description: The reply settings for the tweet

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet

text.description: The text content of the tweet

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served

error.description: Error message describing the reason for the bad request

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition

error.description: Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Retrieves a single tweet by its ID from X (formerly Twitter).
post.description: This function fetches a specific tweet from X using its unique identifier. It allows for optional expansions to be included in the response, providing flexibility in the amount of data retrieved. The function returns a promise that resolves to the tweet data, including details such as the tweet's text, creation time, and author information.

body.description: Body of the get sls call

items.description: The ID of the tweet to retrieve

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet

text.description: The text content of the tweet

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Retrieves multiple tweets by their IDs.
post.description: The getMultiple function fetches multiple tweets from X in a single request. It allows retrieving up to 100 tweets by their unique identifiers, with optional expansions for additional data. This function is useful for efficiently gathering information about multiple tweets in one API call.

body.description: Body of the getMultiple sls call

items.description: An array of tweet IDs to retrieve

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet

text.description: The text content of the tweet

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Delete a tweet by its ID
post.description: This function deletes a specific tweet from X using its unique identifier. It removes the tweet from the platform and returns a confirmation of the deletion. If successful, it provides a boolean indicating whether the tweet was deleted, and if there are any errors, it returns detailed error information.

body.description: Body of the delete sls call

items.description: The ID of the tweet to delete

deleted.description: True if the tweet was deleted, false otherwise

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Retrieves a single user by their username from X.
post.description: This function fetches a specific user from X using their username. It allows for optional expansions to be included in the response. The function returns a promise that resolves to the user data, including various profile information and public metrics.

body.description: Body of the getByUsername sls call

items.description: The username of the user to retrieve

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

post.description: Executes the getByUsernames function with provided parameters

body.description: Body of the getByUsernames sls call

post.summary: Retrieves a single user by their ID from X.
post.description: This function fetches a specific user from X using their unique ID. It allows for optional expansions to be included in the response, providing flexibility in the amount of data retrieved. The function returns a promise that resolves to a UserLookupResponse object containing detailed user information.

body.description: Body of the getById sls call

items.description: The ID of the user to retrieve

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.summary: Retrieves multiple users by their IDs from X.
post.description: This function fetches multiple users from X using their unique IDs. It allows retrieving information for up to 100 users in a single request and provides optional expansions for additional data.

body.description: Body of the getByIds sls call

items.description: An array of user IDs to retrieve

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.description: The getMe function fetches the user associated with the provided access token. It returns detailed information about the authenticated user, including their profile data and public metrics. This function is useful for obtaining the current user's information in applications using OAuth authentication.

body.description: Body of the getMe sls call

items.description: Additional options for retrieving the authenticated user

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.summary: Uploads a media file to X (formerly Twitter) for attachment to a tweet.
post.description: This function uploads a media file to X, which can then be attached to a tweet. It takes a Buffer object containing the media file and its MIME type as parameters, and returns a promise that resolves to a MediaUploadResponse object containing details about the uploaded media.

body.description: Body of the upload sls call

buffer.description: The media file as a Buffer object.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the media file (e.g., "image/jpeg", "video/mp4").

items.description: Parameters for uploading media to X

media_id.description: The media ID as a number.

media_id_string.description: The media ID as a string.

size.description: The size of the media file in bytes.

expires_after_secs.description: The number of seconds until the uploaded media expires.

error.description: Error message describing the bad request.
Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Generates an OAuth 1.0a header for authenticating requests to the X API.
post.description: This function creates the Authorization header required for making authenticated requests to X using OAuth 1.0a. It takes the HTTP method, full URL, and optional additional parameters to generate a properly formatted and signed OAuth header string.

body.description: Body of the generateOAuthHeader sls call

items.description: The full URL of the request
Additional parameters to include in the signature

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the internal server error
